issues.description: The problem statement and template describe an interface named `Milkable`, but the solution repository defines and uses an interface named `Dairy`. This name mismatch will confuse students: they will create `Milkable`, while the solution code expects `Dairy`.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `Dairy` interface and all its usages in the solution repository to `Milkable`, so that it matches the problem statement and template definitions.

issues.description: The problem statement and template define an interface named `Milkable` for the milking behavior, but the solution repository defines this interface as `Dairy`. This naming mismatch between `Milkable` and `Dairy` prevents students from mapping the milking concept consistently across artifacts.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `Dairy` interface in the solution repository to `Milkable` (and adjust implementing classes accordingly) so that the interface name matches the problem statement and template.
